summary: To address safety problems in the Washington, D.C., Metro rail system, Metro started a preventive track maintenance program in June 2017. The program aims to reduce service disruptions caused by track defects or electrical fires—which Metro says are the most significant safety risks. While Metro reports making progress, it can't be sure that the program is designed effectively. For example, the program doesn't address non-electrical...
title: Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority: Actions Needed to Strengthen Capital Planning and Track Preventive Maintenance Program
